titlestmt.titleproper: J. Walter Thompson Company. Chicago Office. Elna Cederholm papers
Guide to the J. Walter Thompson Company. Chicago Office. Elna Cederholm papers, 1955-1973 and undated RL.11773
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-09-30 19:05:07 UTC.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Chicago Office. Elna Cederholm papers

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: J. Walter Thompson Company. Chicago Office

did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. It is headquartered in New York. The Chicago Office opened in 1891. Elna Ann Cederholm was an account representative with the JWT Chicago office in the 1960s and 1970s. Collection includes personal and professional correspondence, travel souvenirs along with work documents pertaining to Cederholm's career as an account representative for JWT on Oscar Mayer advertising campaigns. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. It is headquartered in New York. The Chicago Office opened in 1891. Elna Ann Cederholm was an account representative with the JWT Chicago office in the 1960s and 1970s.

Elna Ann Cederholm born 1940, Indiana. AA, Stephens College (Theatre, Radio and Television) 1960, BA Michigan State University (Communications) 1963. JWT Chicago: Traffic Coordinator 1963-1970; Account Representative 1970-approximately 1974. Left JWT approximately 1974, married JWT executive Ed George 1974. Died 2014 Florida.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. Chicago Office. Elna Cederholm papres were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2015. The papers were removed from the J. Walter Thompson Company Ed George papers.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. Chicago Office. Elna Cederholm papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2015-0055

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes personal and professional correspondence, travel souvenirs along with work documents pertaining to Cederholm's career as an account representative for JWT on Oscar Mayer advertising campaigns. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Hamm's cartooon drawn on napkin; hand-drawn map

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: Postcards, Empire State Building, Drake Hotel, play guides (Coco, Fiddler on the Roof, Oh Calcutta!)
